trans-unit.source: A trigger action that advances a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard"></xref> to the end of its fill period.

Use a SkipStoryboardToFill action with an <xref:System.Windows.EventTrigger> or a <xref:System.Windows.Trigger> to advance a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> to its fill period, if it has one.
This action also advances all child <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline> objects of the target <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> to their fill periods, if they have them.
SkipStoryboardToFill only affects an active <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> (after the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> starts).

Pause, Resume, Stop, or Otherwise Control a Storyboard Interactively To be able to pause, resume, or otherwise control a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> interactively, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> property of its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> and use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ControllableStoryboardAction> object (such as <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.PauseStoryboard>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ResumeStoryboard>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.StopStoryboard>) to control it by referencing its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> is unspecified, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> cannot be interactively controlled after it is begun.
See [How to: Control a Storyboard After It Starts](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for more information.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SkipStoryboardToFill"></xref> class.
